verses.text:
And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years.

And the hand of Midian prevailed against Israel : \add and\add* because of the Midianites the children of Israel made them the dens which \add are\add* in the mountains , and caves , and strong holds.\f + \fr 6.2 \ft prevailed: Heb. was strong\f*
And \add so\add* it was, when Israel had sown , that the Midianites came up , and the Amalekites , and the children of the east , even they came up against them;

And they encamped against them, and destroyed the increase of the earth , till thou come unto Gaza , and left no sustenance for Israel , neither sheep , nor ox , nor ass.\f + \fr 6.4 \ft sheep: or goat\f*

For they came up with their cattle and their tents , and they came as grasshoppers for multitude ; \add for\add* both they and their camels were without number : and they entered into the land to destroy it.
And Israel was greatly impoverished because of the Midianites ; and the children of Israel cried unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ And it came to pass, when the children of Israel cried unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* because of the Midianites ,

That the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* sent a prophet unto the children of Israel , which said unto them, Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of Israel , I brought you up from Egypt , and brought you forth out of the house of bondage ;  +  r 6.8  t a prophet: Heb. a man a prophet *
And I delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians , and out of the hand of all that oppressed you, and drave them out from before you, and gave you their land ;
And I said unto you, I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God ; fear not the gods of the Amorites , in whose land ye dwell : but ye have not obeyed my voice. \p

¶ And there came an angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and sat under an oak which \add was\add* in Ophrah , that \add pertained\add* unto Joash the Abi-ezrite : and his son Gideon threshed wheat by the winepress , to hide \add it\add* from the Midianites.\f + \fr 6.11 \ft Gideon: Gr. Gedeon\f*\f + \fr 6.11 \ft to hide…: Heb. to cause it to flee\f*

And the angel of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* appeared unto him, and said unto him, The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add is\add* with thee, thou mighty man of valour.

And Gideon said unto him, Oh my Lord , if the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* be with us, why then is all this befallen us? and where \add be\add* all his miracles which our fathers told us of, saying , Did not the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* bring us up from Egypt ? but now the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath forsaken us, and delivered us into the hands of the Midianites.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* looked upon him, and said , Go in this thy might , and thou shalt save Israel from the hand of the Midianites : have not I sent thee?

And he said unto him, Oh my Lord , wherewith shall I save Israel ? behold, my family \add is\add* poor in Manasseh , and I \add am\add* the least in my father’s house.\f + \fr 6.15 \ft my family…: Heb. my thousand is the meanest\f*
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto him, Surely I will be with thee, and thou shalt smite the Midianites as one man.
And he said unto him, If now I have found grace in thy sight , then shew me a sign that thou talkest with me.

Depart not hence, I pray thee, until I come unto thee, and bring forth my present , and set \add it\add* before thee. And he said , I will tarry until thou come again.\f + \fr 6.18 \ft present: or, meat offering\f* \p

¶ And Gideon went in , and made ready a kid , and unleavened cakes of an ephah of flour : the flesh he put in a basket , and he put the broth in a pot , and brought \add it\add* out unto him under the oak , and presented \add it\add*.\f + \fr 6.19 \ft a kid: Heb. a kid of the goats\f*
And the angel of God said unto him, Take the flesh and the unleavened cakes , and lay \add them\add* upon this rock , and pour out the broth. And he did so. \p

¶ Then the angel of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* put forth the end of the staff that \add was\add* in his hand , and touched the flesh and the unleavened cakes ; and there rose up fire out of the rock , and consumed the flesh and the unleavened cakes. Then the angel of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* departed out of his sight.

And when Gideon perceived that he \add was\add* an angel of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, Gideon said , Alas , O Lord 
d \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*
d*! for because I have seen an angel of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* face to face.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto him, Peace \add be\add* unto thee; fear not: thou shalt not die.

Then Gideon built an altar there unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and called it Jehovah-shalom : unto this day it \add is\add* yet in Ophrah of the Abi-ezrites.\f + \fr 6.24 \ft Jehovah-shalom: that is, The \+nd LORD\+nd* send peace\f* \p

¶ And it came to pass the same night , that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto him, Take thy father’s young bullock , even the second bullock of seven years old , and throw down the altar of Baal that thy father hath, and cut down the grove that \add is\add* by it:\f + \fr 6.25 \ft even: or, and\f*

And build an altar unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God upon the top of this rock , in the ordered place , and take the second bullock , and offer a burnt sacrifice with the wood of the grove which thou shalt cut down.\f + \fr 6.26 \ft rock: Heb. strong place\f*\f + \fr 6.26 \ft in the ordered…: or, in an orderly manner\f*

Then Gideon took ten men of his servants , and did as the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had said unto him: and \add so\add* it was, because he feared his father’s household , and the men of the city , that he could not do \add it\add* by day , that he did \add it\add* by night. \p

¶ And when the men of the city arose early in the morning , behold, the altar of Baal was cast down , and the grove was cut down that \add was\add* by it, and the second bullock was offered upon the altar \add that was\add* built.
And they said one to another , Who hath done this thing ? And when they enquired and asked , they said , Gideon the son of Joash hath done this thing.
Then the men of the city said unto Joash , Bring out thy son , that he may die : because he hath cast down the altar of Baal , and because he hath cut down the grove that \add was\add* by it.

And Joash said unto all that stood against him, Will ye plead for Baal ? will ye save him? he that will plead for him, let him be put to death whilst \add it is yet\add* morning : if he \add be\add* a god , let him plead for himself, because \add one\add* hath cast down his altar.

Therefore on that day he called him Jerubbaal , saying , Let Baal plead against him, because he hath thrown down his altar.\f + \fr 6.32 \ft Jerubbaal: that is, Let Baal plead\f*\f + \fr 6.32 \ft Jerubbesheth: that is, Let the shameful thing plead\f* \p
¶ Then all the Midianites and the Amalekites and the children of the east were gathered together , and went over , and pitched in the valley of Jezreel.

But the Spirit of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came upon Gideon , and he blew a trumpet ; and Abi-ezer was gathered after him.\f + \fr 6.34 \ft came…: Heb. clothed\f*\f + \fr 6.34 \ft gathered: Heb. called\f*

And he sent messengers throughout all Manasseh ; who also was gathered after him: and he sent messengers unto Asher , and unto Zebulun , and unto Naphtali ; and they came up to meet them.\f + \fr 6.35 \ft gathered: Heb. called\f* \p
¶ And Gideon said unto God , If thou wilt save Israel by mine hand , as thou hast said ,

Behold, I will put a fleece of wool in the floor ; \add and\add* if the dew be on the fleece only, and \add it be\add* dry upon all the earth \add beside\add*, then shall I know that thou wilt save Israel by mine hand , as thou hast said.
And it was so: for he rose up early on the morrow , and thrust the fleece together , and wringed the dew out of the fleece , a bowl full of water.

And Gideon said unto God , Let not thine anger be hot against me, and I will speak but this once : let me prove , I pray thee, but this once with the fleece ; let it now be dry only upon the fleece , and upon all the ground let there be dew.
And God did so that night : for it was dry upon the fleece only, and there was dew on all the ground.
